name: cea-grasshopper
author: daren-thomas

components.name: Archetypes Mapper
components.description: Assign building properties and systems types from the Archetypes DataBase

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: archetypes-mapper:input-databases
inputs.description: List of inputs to map from your databases to your new/existing scenario
inputs.default: comfort, architecture, air-conditioning, internal-loads, supply, schedules

inputs.name: archetypes-mapper:buildings
inputs.description: List of buildings to create schedules for (leave blank to consider all).

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Weather helper
components.description: Sets the weather file to use for simulation for a scenario

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: weather-helper:weather
inputs.description: Either a full path to a weather file or the name of one of the weather files contained within the CEA.

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Surroundings helper
components.description: Query geometry of surrounding buildings from Open Street Maps

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: surroundings-helper:buffer
inputs.description: Perimeter buffer length to the surrounding area (in meters).

inputs.name: surroundings-helper:height-ag
inputs.description: Average height of buildings within the surroundings (in meters). Leave it blank to obtain from Open Street Maps (less accurate).

inputs.name: surroundings-helper:floors-ag
inputs.description: Average number of floors above ground of all buildings within the surroundings. Leave it blank to obtain from Open Street Maps (less accurate).

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Terrain helper
components.description: Query topography with a fixed elevation

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: terrain-helper:grid-size
inputs.description: Grid size for the terrain file (do not use less than 10 meters).

inputs.name: terrain-helper:elevation
inputs.description: Fixed elevation of the terrain (in meters).

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Streets helper
components.description: Query streets geometry from Open Street Maps

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: streets-helper:bbox
inputs.description: The bounding box of the surroundings using the surroundings shapefile (leave blank) or a list of coordinates (bbox = min Longitude , min Latitude , max Longitude , max Latitude)

inputs.name: streets-helper:streets
inputs.description: The type of streets to gather.

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Building Solar radiation
components.description: Use Daysim to calculate solar radiation for a scenario

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: general:multiprocessing
inputs.description: Multiprocessing (if available) for quicker calculation.

inputs.name: general:number-of-cpus-to-keep-free
inputs.description: Limits the maximum number of processors to use for multiprocessing. By default, one CPU is kept free.

inputs.name: general:debug
inputs.description: Enable debugging-specific behaviors.

inputs.name: radiation:buildings
inputs.description: List of buildings considered for the radiation simulation (to simulate all buildings leave blank).

inputs.name: radiation:use-latest-daysim-binaries
inputs.description: Set true to use latest Daysim binaries which is faster and able to run larger sites, but it produces non-deterministic results. Set false to use the old binary for reproducibility.

inputs.name: radiation:albedo
inputs.description: Albedo of the terrain.

inputs.name: radiation:roof-grid
inputs.description: Grid resolution for the roof surfaces. Use 200 (maximum) if you want only one point per surface.

inputs.name: radiation:walls-grid
inputs.description: Grid resolution for wall surfaces. Use 200 (maximum) if you want only one point per surface.

inputs.name: radiation:zone-geometry
inputs.description: Simplification level of the zone geometry (1 is the lowest).

inputs.name: radiation:surrounding-geometry
inputs.description: Simplification level of the surroundings geometry (1 is the lowest).

inputs.name: radiation:consider-floors
inputs.description: True if floors are considered in the geometry.

inputs.name: radiation:consider-intersections
inputs.description: True if intersecting walls between buildings are considered (this increases simulation time in x5), but can give more precise estimates.

inputs.name: radiation:rad-ab
inputs.description: Number of ambient bounces.

inputs.name: radiation:rad-ad
inputs.description: Number of ambient divisions.

inputs.name: radiation:rad-as
inputs.description: Number of ambient super-samples.

inputs.name: radiation:rad-ar
inputs.description: Ambient resolution.

inputs.name: radiation:rad-aa
inputs.description: Ambient accuracy.

inputs.name: radiation:rad-lr
inputs.description: Maximum number of reflections.

inputs.name: radiation:rad-st
inputs.description: Specular sampling threshold.

inputs.name: radiation:rad-sj
inputs.description: Specular sampling jitter.

inputs.name: radiation:rad-lw
inputs.description: Minimum weight of each ray.

inputs.name: radiation:rad-dj
inputs.description: Direct jitter.

inputs.name: radiation:rad-ds
inputs.description: Direct sampling ration.

inputs.name: radiation:rad-dr
inputs.description: Number of relays from secondary sources.

inputs.name: radiation:rad-dp
inputs.description: Secondary source pre-sampling density.

inputs.name: radiation:daysim-bin-directory
inputs.description: Path to the Daysim binaries. This path will be used instead of the default CEA Dependencies.

inputs.name: radiation:n-buildings-in-chunk
inputs.description: Minimum number of building groups (chunks) to be sent for multiprocessing.

inputs.name: radiation:write-sensor-data
inputs.description: Write also data per point in the grid. (Only needed to run solar technologies). False saves space in disk

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Building Schedules
components.description: Use CEA models and input schedules to estimate the occupancy profile of buildings

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: general:multiprocessing
inputs.description: Multiprocessing (if available) for quicker calculation.

inputs.name: general:number-of-cpus-to-keep-free
inputs.description: Limits the maximum number of processors to use for multiprocessing. By default, one CPU is kept free.

inputs.name: general:debug
inputs.description: Enable debugging-specific behaviors.

inputs.name: schedule-maker:buildings
inputs.description: List of buildings considered for the schedule model (to simulate all buildings leave blank).

inputs.name: schedule-maker:schedule-model
inputs.description: Type of schedule model to use (stochastic or deterministic)

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Building Energy demand
components.description: Calculate the Demand

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: general:multiprocessing
inputs.description: Multiprocessing (if available) for quicker calculation.

inputs.name: general:number-of-cpus-to-keep-free
inputs.description: Limits the maximum number of processors to use for multiprocessing. By default, one CPU is kept free.

inputs.name: general:debug
inputs.description: Enable debugging-specific behaviors.

inputs.name: demand:buildings
inputs.description: List of buildings considered for the demand simulation (to simulate all buildings leave blank).

inputs.name: demand:loads-output
inputs.description: List of loads output by the demand simulation (to simulate all load types in demand_writer, leave blank).

inputs.name: demand:massflows-output
inputs.description: List of mass flow rates output by the demand simulation (to simulate all system mass flow rates in demand_writer, leave blank).

inputs.name: demand:temperatures-output
inputs.description: List of temperatures output by the demand simulation (to simulate all temperatures in demand_writer, leave blank).

inputs.name: demand:resolution-output
inputs.description: Time step resolution of the demand simulation (hourly or monthly).

inputs.name: demand:use-dynamic-infiltration-calculation
inputs.description: True if dynamic infiltration calculations are considered (slower run times!).

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Emissions
components.description: Calculate emissions and primary energy due to building, construction, operation, dismantling and induced mobility

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: emissions:year-to-calculate
inputs.description: Defines the time period (year-to-calculate - year_built or year_renovated) over which embodied emissions are calculated. If greater than 60 years, embodied emissions are not considered.

inputs.name: emissions:embodied
inputs.description: Estimate emissions due to construction and dismantling of buidlings (allocated according to the age input database, LCA database and building geometry)

inputs.name: emissions:operation
inputs.description: Estimate emissions due to supply systems operation (allocated according to the supply-systems input database)

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: System Costs
components.description: Calculate costs due to supply systems

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: costs:capital
inputs.description: Estimate Capital costs (total and annualized) due to supply systems (allocated according to the supply-systems input database)

inputs.name: costs:operational
inputs.description: Estimate Operational costs (variable and fixed) due to supply systems operation (allocated according to the supply-systems input database)

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Shallow geothermal potential
components.description: Calculate the heat extracted from a geothermal probes (up to 50 m length)

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: shallow-geothermal:buildings-available
inputs.description: List of buildings whose footprint can be used for shallow geothermal exploration. Leave it blank to get all buildings area

inputs.name: shallow-geothermal:extra-area-available
inputs.description: Add extra area where shallow geothermal probes can be installed in m2.

inputs.name: shallow-geothermal:average-probe-depth
inputs.description: Average depth of geothermal probes in m.

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Water body potential
components.description: Calculate the heat extracted from a lake or a water body

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: water-body:max-water-volume-withdrawal
inputs.description: max water volume that can be withdrawn in m3/h

inputs.name: water-body:max-delta-temperature-withdrawal
inputs.description: max delta of temperature that can be withdrawn in C

inputs.name: water-body:temperature-max
inputs.description: maximum temperature of the water body during the year at the extraction point in C

inputs.name: water-body:temperature-min
inputs.description: = average temperature of the water body during the year at the extraction point (it can be 30m) in C

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Photovoltaic-thermal Panels
components.description: Calculate electricity & heat production from photovoltaic / thermal technologies

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: general:multiprocessing
inputs.description: Multiprocessing (if available) for quicker calculation.

inputs.name: general:number-of-cpus-to-keep-free
inputs.description: Limits the maximum number of processors to use for multiprocessing. By default, one CPU is kept free.

inputs.name: solar:buildings
inputs.description: List of buildings considered for the photovoltaic (PV), photovoltaic thermal (PVT) and solar collector (SC) simulations (to simulate all buildings leave blank).

inputs.name: solar:type-pvpanel
inputs.description: Type of PV panel.

inputs.name: solar:type-scpanel
inputs.description: Type of solar collector: "FP" (Flat-plate) or "ET" (Evacuated-tubes).

inputs.name: solar:panel-on-roof
inputs.description: True if panels are considered on roof surfaces.

inputs.name: solar:panel-on-wall
inputs.description: True if panels are considered on wall surfaces.

inputs.name: solar:annual-radiation-threshold
inputs.description: Only consider panels on surfaces that receive radiation above the defined threshold [kWh/m2/yr].

inputs.name: solar:solar-window-solstice
inputs.description: Desired time of solar exposure on the solstice in hours.

inputs.name: solar:t-in-pvt
inputs.description: Inlet temperature of PVT panels in celsius (if blank: 35C).

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Photovoltaic panels
components.description: Calculate electricity production from solar photovoltaic technologies

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: general:multiprocessing
inputs.description: Multiprocessing (if available) for quicker calculation.

inputs.name: solar:type-pvpanel
inputs.description: Type of PV panel.

inputs.name: general:number-of-cpus-to-keep-free
inputs.description: Limits the maximum number of processors to use for multiprocessing. By default, one CPU is kept free.

inputs.name: solar:panel-on-roof
inputs.description: True if panels are considered on roof surfaces.

inputs.name: solar:panel-on-wall
inputs.description: True if panels are considered on wall surfaces.

inputs.name: solar:annual-radiation-threshold
inputs.description: Only consider panels on surfaces that receive radiation above the defined threshold [kWh/m2/yr].

inputs.name: solar:solar-window-solstice
inputs.description: Desired time of solar exposure on the solstice in hours.

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Sewage heat potential
components.description: Calculate the heat extracted from the sewage heat exchanger.

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: sewage:heat-exchanger-length
inputs.description: Length of pipeline available for a heat exchanger in the sewage in meters (at least 100 meters).

inputs.name: sewage:sewage-water-ratio
inputs.description: Ratio of decrease/increase in sewage water due to solids and water intakes.

inputs.name: sewage:sewage-water-district
inputs.description: How many liters of wastewater come from the neighboring districts thoruhg the heat-exchanger LPs

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Solar collectors
components.description: Calculate heat production from solar collector technologies

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: general:multiprocessing
inputs.description: Multiprocessing (if available) for quicker calculation.

inputs.name: general:number-of-cpus-to-keep-free
inputs.description: Limits the maximum number of processors to use for multiprocessing. By default, one CPU is kept free.

inputs.name: solar:type-scpanel
inputs.description: Type of solar collector: "FP" (Flat-plate) or "ET" (Evacuated-tubes).

inputs.name: solar:panel-on-roof
inputs.description: True if panels are considered on roof surfaces.

inputs.name: solar:panel-on-wall
inputs.description: True if panels are considered on wall surfaces.

inputs.name: solar:annual-radiation-threshold
inputs.description: Only consider panels on surfaces that receive radiation above the defined threshold [kWh/m2/yr].

inputs.name: solar:solar-window-solstice
inputs.description: Desired time of solar exposure on the solstice in hours.

inputs.name: solar:t-in-sc
inputs.description: Inlet temperature of solar collectors in celsius (if blank: 60C for Flat-plate and 75C for Evacuated-tube).

inputs.name: solar:buildings
inputs.description: List of buildings considered for the photovoltaic (PV), photovoltaic thermal (PVT) and solar collector (SC) simulations (to simulate all buildings leave blank).

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Thermal Network Part I (Layout)
components.description: Create a potential layout of the network with the minimum spanning tree

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: network-layout:network-type
inputs.description: Type of district network: "DH" (district heating), or "DC" (district cooling)

inputs.name: network-layout:connected-buildings
inputs.description: List of buildings/customers to connect (blank if all buildings connected).

inputs.name: network-layout:pipe-diameter
inputs.description: Nominal diameter of pipe in mm.

inputs.name: network-layout:type-mat
inputs.description: Type of default material for piping.

inputs.name: network-layout:allow-looped-networks
inputs.description: True if network loops should be created.

inputs.name: network-layout:consider-only-buildings-with-demand
inputs.description: whether when creating networks ONLY buildings with energy demand should be considered or not. default is true

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Thermal Network Part II (simulation)
components.description: Solve the thermal hydraulic network

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: general:multiprocessing
inputs.description: Multiprocessing (if available) for quicker calculation.

inputs.name: general:number-of-cpus-to-keep-free
inputs.description: Limits the maximum number of processors to use for multiprocessing. By default, one CPU is kept free.

inputs.name: thermal-network:network-type
inputs.description: Type of district network to be simulated: "DH" (district heating) or "DC" (district cooling).

inputs.name: thermal-network:network-model
inputs.description: Choose either simplified (seconds) or detailed model (several hours)

inputs.name: thermal-network:min-head-substation
inputs.description: Minimum head loss in kPa expected at each thermal transfer substation

inputs.name: thermal-network:hw-friction-coefficient
inputs.description: Hanzen-Williams friction coefficient considered for the pipes in mm

inputs.name: thermal-network:peak-load-velocity
inputs.description: Maximum velocity expected in pipes in m3/s (Higher values result in smaller pipe diameters)

inputs.name: thermal-network:equivalent-length-factor
inputs.description: fraction of pressure losses expected dues to accessories in the network (valid values within 0.0 and 0.6)

inputs.name: thermal-network:peak-load-percentage
inputs.description: Percentage of the peak demand in % to use for pipe sizing (valid values within 0 and 200)

inputs.name: thermal-network:network-names
inputs.description: List of network file names for either DH (district heating) or DC (district cooling) network types.

inputs.name: thermal-network:set-diameter
inputs.description: True if diameters are set by maximum velocity (2m/s), false if diameters are considered a fixed input.

inputs.name: thermal-network:load-max-edge-flowrate-from-previous-run
inputs.description: True to bypass the calc_max_edge_flowrate function, using results from the previous simulation (useful for debugging).

inputs.name: thermal-network:start-t
inputs.description: Start hour for calculations (0-based).

inputs.name: thermal-network:stop-t
inputs.description: Stop hour for calculations (0-based, upper bound).

inputs.name: thermal-network:use-representative-week-per-month
inputs.description: True to use the data for first week of each month instead of the full month.

inputs.name: thermal-network:minimum-mass-flow-iteration-limit
inputs.description: Maximum number of iterations permitted for the increase of minimum mass flows in the network.

inputs.name: thermal-network:minimum-edge-mass-flow
inputs.description: Minimum mass flow rate permitted in the network (in kg/s). If the mass flow rate in any edge is below this value at any time period, the thermal network will be re-sized accordingly

inputs.name: thermal-network:diameter-iteration-limit
inputs.description: Maximum number of iterations permitted for the network diameter optimization (relevant for looped network result convergence).

inputs.name: thermal-network:substation-cooling-systems
inputs.description: List of cooling loads to be supplied (DC mode)

inputs.name: thermal-network:substation-heating-systems
inputs.description: List of heating loads to be supplied (DH mode)

inputs.name: thermal-network:temperature-control
inputs.description: Type of control strategy for plant operation: "VT" (Variable Temperature / Variable Flow) or "CT" (Constant Temperature / Variable Flow).

inputs.name: thermal-network:plant-supply-temperature
inputs.description: Supply temperature of plants in celsius (relevant if temperature-control is set to 'CT').

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:use-representative-week-per-month
inputs.description: True to use the data for first week of each month instead of the full month.

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Thermal network optimization
components.description: Optimize network design variables (plant locations, layout,...)

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: general:multiprocessing
inputs.description: Multiprocessing (if available) for quicker calculation.

inputs.name: general:number-of-cpus-to-keep-free
inputs.description: Limits the maximum number of processors to use for multiprocessing. By default, one CPU is kept free.

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:network-type
inputs.description: Type of district network to be simulated: "DH" (district heating) or "DC" (district cooling).

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:network-names
inputs.description: List of network file names for either DH (district heating) or DC (district cooling) network types.

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:file-type
inputs.description: Format of the input files (either csv file or a shape file).

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:set-diameter
inputs.description: True if diameters are set by min and max flow rates, false if diameters are considered a fixed input.

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:load-max-edge-flowrate-from-previous-run
inputs.description: True to bypass the calc_max_edge_flowrate function using results from the previous simulation (useful for debugging).

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:start-t
inputs.description: Start hour for calculations (0-based).

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:stop-t
inputs.description: Stop hour for calculations (0-based, upper bound).

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:network-name
inputs.description: Name of the network for which to run the network optimization.

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:possible-plant-sites
inputs.description: List building names considered candidates for plant locations (leave blank if all buildings are considered candidates).

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:min-number-of-plants
inputs.description: Minimum number of plants used for thermal network optimization (minimum value is 1).

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:max-number-of-plants
inputs.description: Maximum number of plants used for thermal network optimization (minimum value is 1).

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:number-of-individuals
inputs.description: Number of individuals at the start of the optimization (parameter for genetic algorithm).

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:chance-of-mutation
inputs.description: Percentage chance of mutation in the genetic algorithm.

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:number-of-generations
inputs.description: Number of generations used for thermal network optimization.

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:lucky-few
inputs.description: Number of individuals which are randomly picked despite not being optimal (must be smaller than the number of individuals minus one).

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:optimize-loop-branch
inputs.description: True if the thermal network optimization will dictate the use of purely branched or mixed network layouts.

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:optimize-network-loads
inputs.description: True if the thermal network optimization will dictate which heat loads are provided by the network.

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:optimize-building-connections
inputs.description: True if the thermal network optimization will dictate which buildings to connect to the network.

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:use-rule-based-approximation
inputs.description: True if the thermal network optimization will use a rule based approach to narrow the solution space (e.g. by limiting the amount of possible plant locations).

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:use-representative-week-per-month
inputs.description: True to use the data for first week of each month instead of the full month.

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:minimum-mass-flow-iteration-limit
inputs.description: Maximum number of iterations permitted for the increase of minimum mass flows in the network.

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:minimum-edge-mass-flow
inputs.description: Minimum mass flow rate permitted in the network (in kg/s). If the mass flow rate in any edge is below this value at any time period, the thermal network will be re-sized accordingly.

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:diameter-iteration-limit
inputs.description: Maximum number of iterations permitted for the network diameter optimization (relevant for looped network result convergence).

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:substation-cooling-systems
inputs.description: List of cooling loads to be supplied (DC mode).

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:substation-heating-systems
inputs.description: List of heating loads to be supplied (DH mode).

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:disconnected-buildings
inputs.description: List of buildings which are disconnected from the network.

inputs.name: thermal-network-optimization:yearly-cost-calculations
inputs.description: True if cost calculations of CT opex and heat/cooling production are based on a yearly basis.

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Supply System Part I (decentralized)
components.description: Run optimization for decentralized operation

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: general:multiprocessing
inputs.description: Multiprocessing (if available) for quicker calculation.

inputs.name: general:number-of-cpus-to-keep-free
inputs.description: Limits the maximum number of processors to use for multiprocessing. By default, one CPU is kept free.

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Supply System Part II (centralized)
components.description: Run optimization for centralized operation

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:debug
inputs.description: Enable debugging-specific behaviors.

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: general:multiprocessing
inputs.description: Multiprocessing (if available) for quicker calculation.

inputs.name: general:number-of-cpus-to-keep-free
inputs.description: Limits the maximum number of processors to use for multiprocessing. By default, one CPU is kept free.

inputs.name: optimization:network-type
inputs.description: District Heating (DH) or District Cooling (DC)

inputs.name: optimization:technologies-dh
inputs.description: Technologies to consider during optimization of the central supply system when DH is selected
inputs.default: NG_Cogen, WB_Cogen, DB_Cogen, NG_BaseBoiler, NG_PeakBoiler, WS_HP, SS_HP, GS_HP, DS_HP, PVT, SC_ET, SC_FP, PV

inputs.name: optimization:technologies-dc
inputs.description: Technologies to consider during optimization of the central supply system when DC is selected
inputs.default: NG_Trigen, WS_BaseVCC, WS_PeakVCC, AS_BaseVCC, AS_PeakVCC, Storage, PV

inputs.name: optimization:population-size
inputs.description: this denotes the number of individuals, leave in blank to compute the suggested by deb et al., 2014 (92)

inputs.name: optimization:number-of-generations
inputs.description: number of generations for genetic algorithm (NSGA-III)

inputs.name: optimization:random-seed
inputs.description: Random seed to make it easy to replicate the results of the scenarios.

inputs.name: optimization:mutation-prob
inputs.description: Mutation probability for genetic algorithm (NSGA-III)

inputs.name: optimization:mutation-method-integer
inputs.description: Mutation method for integer variables (network connectivity)

inputs.name: optimization:mutation-method-continuous
inputs.description: Mutation method for continuous variables (plant capacities)

inputs.name: optimization:crossover-prob
inputs.description: Cross-over probability for genetic algorithm (NSGA-III)

inputs.name: optimization:crossover-method-integer
inputs.description: Crossover method for integer variables (network connectivity)

inputs.name: optimization:crossover-method-continuous
inputs.description: Crossover method for continuous variables (plant capacities)

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: DBF to Excel to DBF
components.description: dbf => xls => DBF

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: dbf-tools:input-file
inputs.description: Path to the DBF or Excel file.

inputs.name: dbf-tools:output-path
inputs.description: Path to save the dbf <-> xls conversion results.

inputs.name: dbf-tools:output-file-name
inputs.description: Name of the output file (without extension).

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Database Initializer
components.description: Initialize databases for CEA

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: data-initializer:databases-path
inputs.description: Either a full path to databases or the standard databases contained within the CEA.

inputs.name: data-initializer:databases
inputs.description: List of databases to initialize from the selected path

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Create new scenario
components.description: Creates a new scenario

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: create-new-scenario:project
inputs.description: Name of the new project.

inputs.name: create-new-scenario:scenario
inputs.description: Name of the baseline scenario.

inputs.name: create-new-scenario:output-path
inputs.description: Path to new project location.

inputs.name: create-new-scenario:zone
inputs.description: Path to geometry of the zone.

inputs.name: create-new-scenario:terrain
inputs.description: Path to the digital elevation model.

inputs.name: create-new-scenario:streets
inputs.description: Path to street geometry.

inputs.name: create-new-scenario:surroundings
inputs.description: Path to geometry of zone and surroundings (blank if shading effects are not considered).

inputs.name: create-new-scenario:typology
inputs.description: Path to typology database (blank if CEA should create one for you).

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Rename building
components.description: Renames a building in the input files

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: rename-building:old
inputs.description: The name of the building to rename

inputs.name: rename-building:new
inputs.description: The new name of the building (must be unique)

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Create mixed use-type
components.description: Creates a new use-type by aggregating values from a list of different use-types

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: create-mixed-use-type:use-type
inputs.description: The name of the new use-type

inputs.name: create-mixed-use-type:metadata
inputs.description: Description for the new use-type

inputs.name: create-mixed-use-type:ratios
inputs.description: List of use type and ratio pairs (e.g. "MULTI_RES|0.5,SCHOOL|0.5")

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Run all plots
components.description: Run all the plots for test purposes

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:project
inputs.description: Select the path of the project you're working on.

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: plots:buildings
inputs.description: List of building names to generate plots (leave blank for all buildings).

inputs.name: plots:building
inputs.description:
Building ID for the Energy Demand, Comfort Plot and Heating Reset-schedule plot. Used only for the
dashboard plots. For the plots tool, use a single building in the "buildings" variable.

inputs.name: plots:categories
inputs.description: List of plot categories to be created.

inputs.name: plots:network-type
inputs.description: Type of district network: "DH" (district heating) or "DC" (district cooling).

inputs.name: plots:network-name
inputs.description: The name of the network to plot (defaults to an empty string).

inputs.name: plots:plant-node
inputs.description: The plant node to plot.

inputs.name: plots:timeframe
inputs.description: Select one individual configuration of the supply system to visualize.

inputs.name: plots:normalization
inputs.description: Select normalization parameter

inputs.name: plots-comparisons:scenarios-and-systems
inputs.description: List of pairs of scenario and systems

inputs.name: plots-comparisons:normalization
inputs.description: Select normalization parameter

inputs.name: plots-optimization:generation
inputs.description: Select one generation of the optimization routine to be plotted.

inputs.name: plots-optimization:normalization
inputs.description: Select normalization parameter

inputs.name: plots-supply-system:system
inputs.description: Select one system of the optimization routine where the supply system is going to be studied.

inputs.name: plots-supply-system:timeframe
inputs.description: Select one individual configuration of the supply system to visualize.

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Multicriteria analysis
components.description: Multicriteria analysis

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: multi-criteria:generation
inputs.description: Generation for which the multi-criteria analysis should be performed.

inputs.name: multi-criteria:annualized-capital-costs
inputs.description: Weight for total annualized costs (as part of economic sustainability).

inputs.name: multi-criteria:total-capital-costs
inputs.description: Weight factor for total investment costs (as part of economic sustainability).

inputs.name: multi-criteria:annual-operation-costs
inputs.description: Weight factor for operation costs (as part of economic sustainability).

inputs.name: multi-criteria:annual-emissions
inputs.description: Weight factor for emissions (as part of environmental sustainability).

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Zone helper
components.description: Query zone geometry from Open Street Maps

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: zone-helper:height-ag
inputs.description: Average height of buildings within the zone (in meters). Leave it blank to obtain from Open Street Maps (less accurate).

inputs.name: zone-helper:floors-ag
inputs.description: Average number of floors above ground of all buildings within the zone. Leave it blank to obtain from Open Street Maps (less accurate).

inputs.name: zone-helper:year-construction
inputs.description: Average year of construction of buildings within the zone. Leave it blank to obtain from Open Street Maps (less accurate).

inputs.name: zone-helper:height-bg
inputs.description: Average height of buildings below ground (in meters).

inputs.name: zone-helper:floors-bg
inputs.description: Average number of floors below ground of all buildings within the zone.

inputs.name: zone-helper:occupancy-type
inputs.description: Predominant occupancy type of all buildings. Use "Get it from open street maps" to obtain from Open Street Maps (less accurate).
inputs.default: Get it from open street maps

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: Create Polygon
components.description: Creates a polygon shapefile from a list of comma-separated coordinate tuples

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: create-polygon:coordinates
inputs.description: Comma-separated list of coordinate tuples i.e. (lat, lon) of the polygon

inputs.name: create-polygon:filename
inputs.description: Name to use for polygon shapefile outputs

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

inputs.name: shapefile-tools:shapefile
inputs.description: Path to the ESRI Shapefile.

inputs.name: shapefile-tools:crs
inputs.description: Contains the value to use for the crs parameter of the shapefile.

inputs.name: shapefile-tools:index
inputs.description: Use this column as the index column of the DataFrame.

inputs.description: True if the geometry column is interpreted as polygon coordinates, false if it is interpreted as a polyline.

components.name: trace-inputlocator
components.description: trace all calls to the InputLocator for a script

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: general:scenario
inputs.description: Select the scenario you're working on.

inputs.name: trace-inputlocator:scripts
inputs.description: Sequential list of scripts to run.

inputs.name: trace-inputlocator:meta-output-file
inputs.description: Path to the filename of the yml output file.

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

components.name: workflow
components.description: Run a workflow.yml file from start to end

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: Set this to true to start computation

inputs.name: workflow:workflow
inputs.description: Either a built-in workflow (district-heating-system / district-cooling-system) OR a path to a user-specified workflow YAML file

inputs.name: workflow:resume
inputs.description: Turn this parameter on to resume the workflow from the last successful step

inputs.name: workflow:resume-file
inputs.description: Path to a file to store information on how to resume a workflow in case it doesn't run through

inputs.name: workflow:trace-input
inputs.description: If true, each step is run with the trace-inputlocator to collect info about locator methods

outputs.name: continue
outputs.description: This is set to true if component successfully ran and start was set to true

description: Rhino/Grasshopper interface to City Energy Analyst scripts
